title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.27 | 17-06-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्या ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मेलितं येनतस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः नमा ओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्
अध्वैत गदाधर श्रीवासाधी गौरभक्त वृण्धा हरे कृष्णा हरे कृष्णा कृष्ण कृष्णा हरे हरे हरे राम हरे रामा रामरामा हरे हरे ओम नमो भगवते वासुदेवाया नारायणम नमस्कृत्या नरम्चेवनरोत्तमं देवीम सरस्वतीम भ्यासम ततो

The meaning of this verse is, Undoubtedly it is wonderful that Dwaraka has defeated the glories of the heavenly planets and has enhanced the celebrity of the earth.
The inhabitants of Dwaraka are always seeing the soul of all living beings, Krishna, in his loving feature. He glances at them and favors them with sweet smiles.

So, this is another description by the ladies of Hastinapura about the good fortune of the residents of Dwaraka, that they are always able to see Krishna, because Krishna lives in Dwaraka, resides in Dwaraka.
And,
Glories of Dwaraka are many, many, many times greater than the glories of the heavenly planets.
For somebody who is a resident of the earth, heavenly planets are many times superior.
But, for residents of Dwaraka, even though they are on the earth planet, Dwaraka is not like any other place on the earth, ordinary place on the earth.
No, it is a very special place, because Krishna has descended.
So, when Krishna descends, Krishna brings with him his transcendental abode.
This is the special thing about Krishna's appearance on this world.
He brings with him his transcendental abode.
His personal associates of the spiritual world come with him.

Considering all this the heavenly planets are more celebrated than the earth. Definitely heavenly planets are much much superior to the earth planet. But the celebrity of earth has defeated that of the heavenly planets because of Dvārakā where Lord Śrī Kṛṣṇa reigned as king.

This is a description of the standard of living of the inhabitants of Dvārakā when Kṛṣṇa was ruling 5000 years back. When Kṛṣṇa appeared. That is described in 10th canto. Very nice description is there. Detailed description.
So when Kṛṣṇa appeared, three places namely Vṛndāvana, Mathura and Dvārakā are more important than the famous planets within the sky.
Because they spread Democratic, nor do dairy.
So Kṛṣṇa was born in Mathura, He was transferred to Vṛndāvana and after some 12 years or so in Vṛndāvana, He went back to Mathura
and from Mathura he went to Dvārakā.
So all these three places where Krishna performed his leela, his pastimes, are very, very, very special.
They are more important than the most famous planets of this entire universe.
These places are perpetually sanctified because whenever the Lord descends on earth,
he displays his transcendental activities, particularly in these three places.
Krishna chooses where he wants to perform his leela when he appears on this earth.
These are the three places.
They are perpetually the holy lands of the Lord, and the inhabitants still take advantage of the holy places,
even though the Lord is now out of their sight.
Even now there are devotees in Dwarka, in Mathura.
In Vrindavan, who are relishing the Lord's pastimes by remembering his leelas,
by meditating on his transcendental form, by hearing his glories from bona fide devotees like that.
The Lord is the soul of all living beings, and he desires always to have,
to be a part of the living beings in their swaroopa, in their constitutional position to participate in transcendental life, in his association.
What is our actual position?
It's not the position we have now, or not the positions we aspire in our ordinary material life.
No, that's not our actual position.
Our actual position is in relationship with Krishna, in his association.
It is a spiritual position,
free from all the shackles of the world.
It is a spiritual position, free from all the shackles of the world.
Free from all these material defects, material inebriaties, material insufficiencies.
So we have got what is called as our eternal position
in relationship with Krishna called svaroopa,
that's our original position,
and in that position we are with Krishna

transcendental pastimes and experiencing the highest bliss, eternal life full of knowledge, his attractive features are sweet, very, very, very nice and his sweet smiles go deep into the heart of everyone

and once it is so done, the living being is admitted into the kingdom of God. Just one glance of Krishna with his sweet smile on anyone will attract that person to actually go to the kingdom of Krishna in the spiritual world.
And having gone there, Bhagavad Gita says one never returns to this material world ever again. This is confirmed in the Bhagavad Gita.

The heavenly planets may be very famous for offering better facilities of material enjoyment, but we learn that in the Bhagavad Gita, it is said, if one goes to the heavenly planets, one comes back to this earth planet after exhausting this pious credits.
But once having gone to
The abode of the Lord one never returns. That's the big difference between the heavenly planets and the abode of the Lord. I'll stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
